title: China says celebrities have 10 days to cough up unpaid taxes
content:
1. China says celebrities have 10 days to cough up unpaid taxes  msnNOW
  2. China’s celebrities, influencers given 10 days to pay outstanding taxes  South China Morning Post
  3. After crackdown on 'livestreaming queen,' China tells celebrities to get their taxes in order  NBC News
  4. China puts regulatory spotlight on livestream retail boom  The Japan Times
  5. Taxation bureaus across China request livestreamers assess tax liabilities following Viya's $210m record fine  Global Times
contentSnippet:
China says celebrities have 10 days to cough up unpaid taxes  msnNOW
China’s celebrities, influencers given 10 days to pay outstanding taxes  South China Morning Post
After crackdown on 'livestreaming queen,' China tells celebrities to get their taxes in order  NBC News
China puts regulatory spotlight on livestream retail boom  The Japan Times
Taxation bureaus across China request livestreamers assess tax liabilities following Viya's $210m record fine  Global Times

localize.title: 中国、著名人に10日以内に未納税金を吐き出すよう要請
中国称名人有10天时间交出未缴税款
中國稱名人有10天時間交出未繳稅款
